job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist (RRT) in Lawrence, KS
pros: Smaller community Hospital. Coworkers feel like family.
cons: Small hospital so not a lot of variety

review_title: Good experience for entry level staff
pros: Workplace culture Leadership encourages self-care Occasional pay differentials offered when short-staffed
cons: There are some unprofessional staff members, whose behavior goes unchecked

review_title: Constant Lies from TRC and LMH leadership
job_title: Behavioral Health Specialist in Lawrence, KS
pros: Decent pay and benefits. Not much else.
cons:
It's clear a lot of the Emergency Room staff do not have the ability to obtain employment elsewhere.

If you care about patient outcomes this isn't the place to be. 

LKPD treats it like the drunk tank at the jail.

TRC Leadership is FUBAR.

pros: Large number of Specialists, services and clinics, big plus! Has a long standing desire to serve the local market in the best ways possible. Community seemed to support the health system consistently. Given much autonomy in job to lead, that was much appreciated.
cons: From an employee standpoint, benefits were sub-par. Human Resources a mess at the top. Overall health system leadership at top was very far from frontline staff. Much pressure on middle-management to maintain whole relationship throughout facility.

pros: The Manager is amazing-she has kept our department together during the pandemic. If you're looking for a great manager and department go here! If you're looking for a great department director you should recruit her!
cons: Senior administration does not care about the employees at all. We received a 3% cost of living raise this year but the cost of our prescriptions increased by 33%. LMH continues to prove to employees that they do not care about us. They refuse give raises to maintain staff, the staff leaves and then the hospital will pay who knows how much to an agency staff member who is only there to make money. The agency staff does not care about putting the patient first or better together.

review_title: LMH Health is a good place to work!
pros:
Great leadership and HR team.
Laboratory staff feel like family.
Ability to learn and cross-train in multiple departments.
Amazing training from supervisors.
cons:
Pay is lower than competitors.
Plenty of work drama and gossipers.
Short-staffed 
Always asked to cover shifts and stay late

pros: Scheduling is ok. LIS is ok. Instruments are ok.
cons: Interdepartmental tension due to lack of understanding of lab duties and responsibilities. Work volume and stress.

review_title: Don’t hold true to their values.
job_title: Clinic Support Specialist in Lawrence, KS
pros: You get the main holidays off.
cons: They say they are patient first but if you have ever worked in the medical field, that’s not entirely true, it’s mostly about profit. Pay doesn’t match the work, especially if your not clinical staff.

cons: The Upper level management was/is the con

review_title: Used to be great, now, not so much…

pros: LMH Health is a fantastic small hospital with a top notch staff. They have great services and are a real asset to the community.
cons: Sometimes care has to be coordinated with a larger hospital and this can be time-consuming

review_title: Don't work as a tech unless you need the experience.

pros: Beautiful facility and some good practices in place
cons: Too many chiefs and not enough Indians, everyone either wants to be the boss or thinks they are. Creates an environment of backstabbers instead of team players

pros: Great teamwork with my coworkers.

pros: No commute, love my job- hate the company

pros: Pay has been okay and opportunities for extra hours
cons: Some different departments are harder to work with

pros: The people that work there are so wonderful, the benefits are pretty good
cons: None at the particular moment

pros: I have seen a lot of changes at LMH in my years and never has the culture and stability of this organization has never been better. LMH has been good to me, affording me opportunities I would never dream of attaining and I believe there is no better place to work than here.
cons: It's health care, there are always challenges, challenges are our business. However, we are a stand alone, non-profit hospital, if you are looking for end of the year bonus' and performance raises, you need to look elsewhere.

job_title: Desktop Support Technician in Lawrence, KS
pros: The people, including the management are great and you really feel like you are part of a small community rather than a cog in a machine. People know you name and appreciate what you do.
cons: From an IT perspective, issue priority can be difficult due to the impact to patient care that some issues can present. Users have issues understanding workload and factors that can delay issue resolution.

pros: It's a 100 top hospital for multiple years in a row. Good health insurance. Nice environment.
cons: High turnover for many RNs and upper management. People who should be fired aren't let go and they don't contribute to the team work.

review_title: Great place, if you can fit into the right clique.
pros: Location, salary, benefits, cafeteria are great for employees. Highly rated facility for Truven Health listing. Electronic/computerized documentation and medication access stations.
cons: Team-building is somewhat lacking. It is an exceptionally different place to break in if you don't have someone pulling for you on the inside.

pros: Co-workers were great.  You  felt like part of a family, sometimes dysfunctional but you felt part of a family
cons: The adminstration wan't consistent.  They were very reactive to any problem or issue instead of proactive.   Administration doesn't always listen to suggestions.

job_title: RN Case Manager in New London, CT
pros: Innovative staffing of hospital floors utilizing hospitalists on same floor  all the time.  Gave patients a feeling of continuity in their treatment plans.
cons: Managers did not share well all changes that were being made until changed had been made.

pros: Great benefits, cafeteria, breaks every two hours, take care of workers, work is fairly easy
cons: Can be high stress at times, job requires you to have a strong stomach, would be difficult to raise family on this salary
